metadata.title: CVE-2015-2305 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the regcomp implementation in the Henry Spencer BSDregex library (aka rxspencer) alpha3.8.g5 on 32-bit platforms, as used inNetBSD through 6.1.5 and other products, might allow context-dependentattackers to execute arbitrary code via a large regular expression thatleads to a heap-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

librcsb-core-wrapper0 - 1.005-3
python-corepywrap - 1.005-3
No subscription required

clang-3.5 - 1:3.5.2-2
clang-3.5-examples - 1:3.5.2-2
clang-format-3.5 - 1:3.5.2-2
clang-modernize-3.5 - 1:3.5.2-2

criterions.comment: librcsb-core-wrapper package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.005-3').
llvm-toolchain-3.5 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.5.2-2').
llvm-toolchain-3.6 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.6.2-3ubuntu2').
newlib package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-3').
yap package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.2-3').
vigor package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.016-24').
clamav package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.98.7+dfsg-0ubuntu1').
nvi: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
openrpt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
radare2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
